citation.article-title: Propionicicella superfundia gen. nov., sp. nov., a chlorosolvent-tolerant propionate-forming, facultative anaerobic bacterium isolated from contaminated groundwater.

p.s: Description of Propionicicella gen. nov. (Rainey, da Costa, and Moe)

Propionicicella (Pro.pi.o.ni.ci.cel'la, N.L. n. acidum propionicum, propionic acid; L. fem. n. cella, a storeroom, chamber and in biology a cell; N.L. fem. n. Propionicicella, a propionic acid producing cells)
Propionicicella cells are Gram-positive and rod-shaped, mesophilic, facultively anaerobic, chemo-heterotrophic.
Propionate and acetate are produced when grown anaerobically on glucose.
Major cellular fatty acids are C15:0, iso C16:0 and anteiso C15:0.
Sugars and organic acids are used as carbon and energy sources.
The G+C content of the type species is 69.9 mol%.
On the basis of 16S rRNA gene sequences, BL-10T belongs to the class Actinobacteria.
The genera Propionicimonas and Micropruina are the most closely related genera.
The type species is Propionicicella superfundia.
